t: Luke 11
Jesus’ Teaching on Prayer
One*p day Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”
He*p said to them, “When*r you*r pray,*r say:*r “ ‘Father,*rpn hallowed*rln be*r your*r name,*r your*rln kingdom*r come.*r
Give*rln us*r each*r day*r our*r daily*r bread.*r
Forgive*rln us*r our*r sins,*r for*rld we*r also*r forgive*r everyone*r who*r sins*r against*r us.*r And*rln lead*r us*r not*r into*r temptation.’ ”*r
Then*p Jesus said to them, “Suppose*r you*r have*r a*r friend,*r and*r you*r go*r to*r him*r at*r midnight*r and*r say,*r ‘Friend,*r lend*r me*r three*r loaves*r of*r bread;*r
a*r friend*r of*r mine*r on*r a*r journey*r has*r come*r to*r me,*r and*r I*r have*r no*r food*r to*r offer*r him.’*r

And*r suppose*r the*r one*r inside*r answers,*r ‘Don’t*r bother*r me.*r The*r door*r is*r already*r locked,*r and*r my*r children*r and*r I*r are*r in*r bed.*r I*r can’t*r get*r up*r and*r give*r you*r anything.’*r

“So*rp I*r say*r to*r you:*r Ask*r and*r it*r will*r be*r given*r to*r you;*r seek*r and*r you*r will*r find;*r knock*r and*r the*r door*r will*r be*r opened*r to*r you.*r
For*r everyone*r who*r asks*r receives;*r the*r one*r who*r seeks*r finds;*r and*r to*r the*r one*r who*r knocks,*r the*r door*r will*r be*r opened.*r
“Which*rp of*r you*r fathers,*r if*r your*r son*r asks*r for*r a*r fish,*r will*r give*r him*r a*r snake*r instead?*r
Or*r if*r he*r asks*r for*r an*r egg,*r will*r give*r him*r a*r scorpion?*r

Jesus and Beelzebul
Jesus*p was driving out a demon that was mute. When the demon left, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowd was amazed.
But some of them said, “By Beelzebul, the prince of demons, he is driving out demons.”
Others tested him by asking for a sign from heaven.
Jesus*p knew their thoughts and said to them: “Any*r kingdom*r divided*r against*r itself*r will*r be*r ruined,*r and*r a*r house*r divided*r against*r itself*r will*r fall.*r
If*r Satan*r is*r divided*r against*r himself,*r how*r can*r his*r kingdom*r stand?*r I*r say*r this*r because*r you*r claim*r that*r I*r drive*r out*r demons*r by*r Beelzebul.*r
Now*r if*r I*r drive*r out*r demons*r by*r Beelzebul,*r by*r whom*r do*r your*r followers*r drive*r them*r out?*r So*r then,*r they*r will*r be*r your*r judges.*r
But*r if*r I*r drive*r out*r demons*r by*r the*r finger*r of*r God,*r then*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r come*r upon*r you.*r

When*r it*r arrives,*r it*r finds*r the*r house*r swept*r clean*r and*r put*r in*r order.*r

Then*r it*r goes*r and*r takes*r seven*r other*r spirits*r more*r wicked*r than*r itself,*r and*r they*r go*r in*r and*r live*r there.*r And*r the*r final*r condition*r of*r that*r person*r is*r worse*r than*r the*r first.”*r

He*p replied, “Blessed*r rather*r are*r those*r who*r hear*r the*r word*r of*r God*r and*r obey*r it.”*r
The Sign of Jonah
As*p the crowds increased, Jesus said, “This*r is*r a*r wicked*r generation.*r It*r asks*r for*r a*r sign,*r but*r none*r will*r be*r given*r it*r except*r the*r sign*r of*r Jonah.*r

The Lamp of the Body

“No*rp one*r lights*r a*r lamp*r and*r puts*r it*r in*r a*r place*r where*r it*r will*r be*r hidden,*r or*r under*r a*r bowl.*r Instead*r they*r put*r it*r on*r its*r stand,*r so*r that*r those*r who*r come*r in*r may*r see*r the*r light.*r

Your*r eye*r is*r the*r lamp*r of*r your*r body.*r When*r your*r eyes*r are*r healthy,*r your*r whole*r body*r also*r is*r full*r of*r light.*r But*r when*r they*r are*r unhealthy,*r your*r body*r also*r is*r full*r of*r darkness.*r
See*r to*r it,*r then,*r that*r the*r light*r within*r you*r is*r not*r darkness.*r

Therefore,*r if*r your*r whole*r body*r is*r full*r of*r light,*r and*r no*r part*r of*r it*r dark,*r it*r will*r be*r just*r as*r full*r of*r light*r as*r when*r a*r lamp*r shines*r its*r light*r on*r you.”*r
Woes on the Pharisees and the Experts in the Law
When*p Jesus had finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to eat with him; so he went in and reclined at the table.
But the Pharisee was surprised when he noticed that Jesus did not first wash before the meal.
Then*p the Lord said to him, “Now*r then,*r you*r Pharisees*r clean*r the*r outside*r of*r the*r cup*r and*r dish,*r but*r inside*r you*r are*r full*r of*r greed*r and*r wickedness.*r
You*r foolish*r people!*r Did*r not*r the*r one*r who*r made*r the*r outside*r make*r the*r inside*r also?*r
But*r now*r as*r for*r what*r is*r inside*r you—be*r generous*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r everything*r will*r be*r clean*r for*r you.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you*r Pharisees,*r because*r you*r give*r God*r a*r tenth*r of*r your*r mint,*r rue*r and*r all*r other*r kinds*r of*r garden*r herbs,*r but*r you*r neglect*r justice*r and*r the*r love*r of*r God.*r You*r should*r have*r practiced*r the*r latter*r without*r leaving*r the*r former*r undone.*r
